downloadTitle: Microsoft Windows DirectAccess Client Troubleshooting Tool
detailsSection:
The DirectAccess Client Troubleshooting Tool is a graphical application, based on the .NET Framework, which checks the health of a DirectAccess client by running various tests. 

Built-in health tests:
The following tests are currently implemented:
Network interfaces
Network location (NLS and NRPT DNS)
IP connectivity (6to4, Teredo, IPHTTPS, entry point in a multisite setup, DNS)
Windows Firewall (applied profile, Firewall outbound rules)
Certificates (EKU Client Authentication, trust chain for AIA and CRL)
IPsec infrastructure tunnel (Domain SysVol share)
IPsec intranet tunnel (PING and HTTP probes)

Additional features
Run post-check script (PowerShell, VBScript, BAT or CMD file)
systemRequirementsSection: Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, .NET Framework 4 Client Profile (required for Windows 7)
installInstructionSection:
1. Run DAClientTroubleshooter.exe on a DirectAccess client computer.
2. Click Run Tests.
3. Select the check box Enable debug mode to open an addition window with more detailed information regarding the tests.
